newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea's CDMA mobile phone subscribers pass 1 mln.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea's CDMA mobile phone subscribers pass 1 mln.

text.p: South Korean subscribers to code division multiple access (CDMA) standard cellular phone services have passed the one million mark one year after the standard was launched, the nation's cellular operators said on Monday.
Spokesmen for Korea Mobile Telecom Co and Shinsegi Telecomm Inc said subscribers to their CDMA phone services stood at 723,000 and 343,000, respectively, as of early this month.
CDMA is a technology for digital transmission of data by cellular phone.
It is in use in South Korea, Hong Kong and the United States, while its rival time division multiple access (TDMA) standard prevails elsewhere.
Korea Mobile launched the CDMA phone service in January 1996 and Shinsegi began service in April. Pohang Iron and Steel Co and the Kolon Group are the main shareholders in Shinsegi.
Korea Mobile expects CDMA phone subcribers to rise to 2.3 million by the end of this year, while Shinsegi sees the number growing to 1.3 million.
Korea Mobile also operates analog cellular phone services, which now have about 2.3 million subscribers.
